Occam Feature List

Occam Feature Checklist    
Capability Controlled by Parameter Comments
Generate/display lattice of structures action=lat  
Generate only loopless structures post-model-constrain  
Generate only partition structures post-model-constrain  
Generate structures for directed or undirected system variable types  
Generate/display information theoretic measures action=lat Displays H, %dH, dH/Hx, LR, dDF, Alpha. Is this for directed systems only?
Generate H(DV|IV) for all combinations of IV variables (up to some limit) maxiv  
Sort data by user-specified measure sort  
Print only the n best predicting IV sets for each #IV nmaxdh  
Print only measures where alpha is less than some cutoff value alpha-cutoff  
Generate transmissions   Displays Relation, T, LR, dDF, Alpha. Which transmissions are chosen for printing?
Fit a particular model to the saturated or independence model, and display fit measures action=fit LLR, Pearson X2, DF, T, %captured info, normalized DF, captured info * normalized DF
Allow a specific model to be specified, using short or long variable names short-model, long-model  
Allow reference to be either the top or bottom reference-model  
Search Lattice of Models for Best Fits action=search  
Reference model for search can be top or bottom reference-model Default is bottom for directed, top for neutral
Search direction can be up or down search-direction Default is up for directed, down for neutral
Fixed-window breadth-first search optimize-search-width, search-levels Need to allow other heuristics
Display can be sorted by user-specified parameter sort  
Can do search on directed or undirected systems variable types Determines which models are generated at each level
Fitting constraint can be specified constraint information or ndf, and a value. What is ndf?
Optimization parameter can be specified optimize alpha, information, entropy, lr
The maximum number of IPF iterations can be specified ipf-maxit needed?
The maximum deviation in the IPF can be specified ipf-maxdev How is this defined?
Set-theoretic analysis can be done action=recons TBD
     
Options can be specified for handling input data    
Data can be either frequencies or occurrences no-frequency  
Missing values can be given a constant probability zero-value needed?
Data can be dumped to a file after loading dump-data needed? Where does it go?
Options can be specified for reports    
The alpha for power computations can be set palpha  
The number of best reports can be set limit What operations does this apply to?
The report title can be set title  
The residual plot type can be set res none, observed, fit, both; how does this work?
The std's for confidence bands can be set res-confband what is this?
The residual plot can be sorted res-sorted what is this?
The residual table can be printed res-sorted what is this?
Other options can be set    
The file can consist of only data (no options) no-parse presumably this is used when all options are set on the command line
A more verbose printing mode is provided verbose prints variable and interaction lists; maybe other debugging information?
Help and usage can be printed help, usage  
The program version can be printed version  
Variables can have a long and short name nominal will allow for short names of more than one character
Variables can be independent or dependent nominal  
Certain columns in the data can be ignored    
     
Future features to be integrated    
Input data can be preprocessed, e.g. by binning, and then sent into analysis    
Occurrence data can be converted to set data    
Structural zeros can be specified    
State-based models can be implemented    
Fourier-based fitting can be used for search    
A value in a column can be used to select a subset of the data    

Last Updated on 5/19/00
By Kenneth Willett
